image.altText: A sign at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: Australia's Family Court and child protection systems sometimes accuse mothers of "fictitious or malicious" claims about domestic violence, despite evidence to support their accounts, a royal commission has been told.

title.children: Mothers’ domestic violence reports dismissed by court, child protection

image.altText: A man in a plaid yellow shirt, glasses and face mask walks out of court being questioned by reporters.

props.synopsis: Former massage therapist Sumit Satish Rastogi, who has pleaded guilty to almost 100 sexual abuse offences against 40 women, has resorted to telling an Adelaide judge "I beg you" while asking for "one more day" on bail — but the request was knocked back on the basis it was "inappropriate" for him to remain in the community.

title.children: Massage therapist who sexually abused 40 women 'begs' to stay on bail

image.altText: Police officers look inside cardboard boxes outside a shed with a truck nearby

props.synopsis: Police say they have seized almost $800,000 worth of tobacco and $66,000 in cash after raiding 10 properties in the state's south-east.

title.children: One arrest after police seize tobacco and cash in SA raids

image.altText: A row of 12 guns resting diagonally on the front of a white car.

props.synopsis: A large amount of cash, guns and collectable coins have been recovered, and two men arrested in western New South Wales, following a violent break-in at a home in regional South Australia.

title.children: Huge haul of cash and guns recovered in NSW after SA home break-in, police say

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Brock Yandle, the brother of accused murderer Keith Yandle, told police he heard screaming and gunshots on the night Steven Murphy was killed in a shed at Kudla, a jury has heard.

title.children: 'He kept screaming': Jury told accused murderer's brother heard shooting

image.altText: Two men standing with fruit vines in the background

props.synopsis: A 15-kilometre "suspension zone" was enacted in January after Queensland fruit fly maggots were found in homegrown peaches at Glynde, north-east of the Adelaide CBD. Two Adelaide Hills strawberry growers are calling for changes to national fruit fly protocols.

title.children: After fruit fly was found in the suburbs, growers can't sell in the hills

image.altText: An artist's projection of the Hydrostor facility near Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: An old mine in Broken Hill will be re-purposed by Canadian company Hydrostor as an "innovative" renewable energy storage and generation project tipped to create hundreds of local construction jobs.

title.children: Green light for nation's first underground compressed air energy plant

image.altText: Dorcy Rugamba looking up and to the side, standing with arms folded, slightly smiling.

props.synopsis: One of the stand-out shows at this year's Adelaide Festival is a devastating performance of love for family and for country. In it, audiences hear from a renowned Rwandan playwright who refused to let anger ruin him.

title.children: When Dorcy's family were killed, anger froze him. Telling his story helped

image.altText: Close-up of a person wearing a smart watch

props.synopsis: Flinders University researchers say young adults who use diet and fitness apps are more likely to obsess over diet than those who don't use them.

title.children: Fitness apps can lead to disordered eating and excessive exercise, study finds

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas wearing a navy suit sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government first held talks with insolvency firm KordaMentha about placing the Whyalla steelworks into administration on December 23, new documents reveal.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks administration talks began before Christmas

image.altText: Crime scene tape outside a home.

props.synopsis: South Australia's youth justice system was 'flooded' with almost 6,000 new cases last year, data obtained by the state's opposition shows, while the state's top cop is frustrated at the level of resourcing needed to tackle repeat young offenders.

title.children: Youth justice system 'flooded' in SA as top cop expresses frustration at repeat offenders

image.altText: A teenaged girl wearing a broad brimmed hat smiling and standing in front of a group of sheep.

props.synopsis: When the 19-year-old's phone fell from her ute tray while she was checking water troughs in far west New South Wales, it triggered a region-wide emergency response.

title.children: Smartphone mishap triggers big outback crash 'emergency'

image.altText: A woman with shoulder-length grey hair and glasses smiling in a paddock wearing a black wool jumper.

props.synopsis: A determined group of Kangaroo Island farmers has turned an unlikely dream into reality by opening a local wool mill in the wake of the Black Summer bushfires.

title.children: Wool mill born from disaster marks new chapter on SA island

image.altText: A profile photo of a man with apparent face art.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering his cellmate in an Adelaide prison has been declared mentally incompetent to commit the crime and found not guilty.

title.children: Man accused of cellmate murder found not guilty by reason of mental incompetence

image.altText: A fawn dingo looks on from behind a mesh fence in bushland

props.synopsis: Farmers are concerned after a bushfire revealed a dingo breeding site has been operating in Victoria's Little Desert National Park, but a conservationist says it poses no threat to livestock.

title.children: Farmers call for public meeting amid dingo breeding site discovery

image.altText: The front entrance of a hospital with a red-tiled roof and a driving bay and two flag poles out front.

props.synopsis: A locum doctor who walked out of a contract at Port Pirie Hospital after 45 minutes because it was "so understaffed that it was dangerous" has lost an appeal over her conduct. Dr Amira Mahboub saw just one patient before she left and failed to alert the appropriate managers she would not finish the contract.

title.children: Locum doctor left SA hospital, saying working there was 'too dangerous'

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young man cleaning a gun, cigarette in mouth

props.synopsis: More than 50 years ago, five young men from a small farming community fought in the Vietnam War. Now their stories have been written so people will know them more than "just a name on a plaque".

title.children: Vietnam vet has never worn his medals but his story is immortalised

image.altText: SA driver captured by mobile detection camera appeared to show them holding a burger and a mobile phone

props.synopsis: SA Police have released more images captured by mobile detection cameras showing drivers using phones, not having any hands on the wheel and not observing due care while driving.

title.children: Warning to distracted drivers after 17 lives lost on SA roads this year

image.altText: Dan Bongino speaks at a Conservative political Action Committee conference in 2014

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump announced the appointment in a post on his Truth Social platform, praising Dan Bongino as "a man of incredible love and passion for our country".

title.children: Podcaster picked by Trump for FBI deputy says 'cutesy time is over'

image.altText: A blonde woman listens intently during a senate estimates hearing

props.synopsis: The ABC faces questions at Senate estimates about a contract dispute involving former staff member Antoinette Lattouf. Take a look back on how the day's events unfolded.

title.children: ABC tells Senate estimates it has spent $1.1m defending itself in Lattouf case — as it happened

image.altText: Several new townhouses in a row

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan announces a policy to supercharge townhouse development — the government's next pillar of its housing policy with the aim to relieve the state's housing crisis.

title.children: Victoria wants to become the country's 'townhouse capital' — here's how

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Elon Musk emailed the nation's civil service workers asking them to justify their jobs, sparking pushback from some agencies and unions.

title.children: Musk renews firing threat after being stymied by federal officials

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: Queensland woman Toyah Cordingley may still have been alive when she was buried on a remote beach, a court has heard.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley may have been alive when buried on beach, jury hears

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Network Ten is ordered to pay journalist Lisa Wilkinson more than $1 million to cover costs incurred for her personal legal representation in the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case.

title.children: Network Ten ordered to pay Lisa Wilkinson $1.15m for court costs

image.altText: A photo of a woman sitting in a brightly lit restaurant

props.synopsis: A man who murdered his heavily pregnant lover after trying to pressure her into terminating the pregnancy is sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: Life in jail for man who murdered woman because he didn't want her to have his baby

image.altText: A young man looks at two young women in swimsuits as he walks by them lounging.

props.synopsis: Fans have noticed that seasons one and three of The White Lotus have a distinctly yellow tone to their colour grading. And the reason for that comes from a 2000 Steven Soderbergh film.

title.children: TV shows love to use a yellow filter. Here's why that can be dangerous

image.altText: A bald man with a grey long beard stares at the cmaera. Fair skin, elderly and blue eyes. Close up image.

props.synopsis: Long-term residents of a WA caravan park say they feel let down after being told they have six months to find somewhere else to live.

title.children: Pensioners evicted from caravan park despite living there for decades

image.altText: A brightly coloured sign that says "LiveBetter" out the front of an office building.

props.synopsis: A regional NSW care service is facing criminal charges over the death of a disabled woman who suffered burns to up to 40 per cent of her body in a bathtub.

title.children: NDIS provider charged over woman's fatal bathwater burns

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman standing at a lectern onstage and speaking into a microphone, in front of a cenotaph.

props.synopsis: Lia Finocchiaro has described acknowledgements of country as "divisive" and "tokenistic", in defending her decision not to acknowledge Darwin's traditional owners in a war anniversary speech.

title.children: Elder upset after NT chief minister omits Aboriginal acknowledgement

image.altText: Close up of eggs on a green tray.

props.synopsis: The new detection of H7N8 bird flu is linked to the ongoing outbreak at Kinross Farms, as shopper grapple with an egg shortage at supermarkets.

title.children: Bird flu detected at another farm of major supermarket egg supplier

image.altText: A police crime scene

props.synopsis: A dispute between neighbours over loud music escalated into a street fight where a woman was doused in flammable liquid and set on fire with a blowtorch, a Victorian court has heard.

title.children: Court hears woman set on fire after neighbourly dispute over loud music

image.altText: a mosquito

props.synopsis: A Sydney man dies after contracting Japanese encephalitis while on holiday in southern NSW. It is the state's third confirmed death from the disease since it was first detected in the state in 2022.

title.children: Sydney man dies from mosquito-borne disease picked up while on holiday

image.altText: A wall of Nike sneakers sealed in plastic wrapping.

props.synopsis: More than $US2 million ($3.1 million) worth of Nike sneakers has been stolen off a train in the United States.

title.children: Millions of dollars of Nike shoes stolen in desert heist
